#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Pétion-Ville
#Text=Pétion-Ville is a wealthy suburb to the southeast of Port-au-Prince , in Central Haiti .
#Text=It is known for its nightlife and restaurants , many of which have large expat crowds .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Pétion-Ville is in the hills east and separate of the city itself on the northern hills of the Massif de la Selle .
#Text=It was named after Alexandre Sabès Pétion ( 1770 – 1818 ) , the Haitian general and president later recognized as one of the country 's four founding fathers .
#Text=The district is primarily a residential and tourist area .

#Text=Pétion-Ville is part of the city 's metropolitan area , one of the most affluent areas of the city , where the majority of tourist activity takes place , and one of the wealthiest parts of the country .
#Text=Many diplomats , foreign businessmen , and a large number of wealthy citizens do business and reside within Pétion-Ville .

#Text=Despite the distance from the capital and the general affluence of the district , the lack of administrative enforcement has led to the formation of shantytowns on the outer edges of the district , as poor locals migrate upward and have settled there in search of job opportunities .
#Text=Pétion-Ville has more security than the center of Port-au-Prince , and in general , than the other major cities of Haiti .
#Text=The community is very stable , with nightlife and business conducted with an appearance of western normality , in striking contrast to many other parts of greater Port-au-Prince .
#Text=The hillside suburban town is filled with nightclubs , beauty salons , fitness gyms and French restaurants .
#Text=Businesses which cater to tourists are commonplace , and parties and get-togethers often take place at night .
#Text=By plane

#Text=Port au Prince airport ( PAP ) is served by several major airlines - primarily American Airlines and Delta - as well as smaller flights from the Dominican Republic , Cuba , and other spots in the Caribbean .
#Text=Taxis from the airport to your destination in Port au Prince will be about US$ 20 for standard fare .
#Text=Try to bargain down to US$ 15 .
#Text=Tap taps going to all places past the airport and will cost about G10 ( gourdes ) ( 25 cents ) .
#Text=Transit network map shows main routes : http://TapTapMap.org
#Text=By car
#Text=Traffic is bad in and out of Petion-Ville but many roads are quite scenic , looking back towards Port-au-Prince .
#Text=By bus
#Text=From Santo Domingo , Caribe Tours runs a once-daily bus to Pétion-Ville ( in the hills above Port-au-Prince ) that leaves at 11AM .
#Text=A ticket costs US$ 40 one-way + $ 26 tax and + 100 Dominican pesos .
#Text=Terra-bus may also still be serving the Santa Domingo-PAP route .
#Text=Crowded tap-taps ( passenger pickup trucks ) and buses can take you to Pétion-Ville for a few dollars , but can be dangerous .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Tap-taps run along prescribed routes throughout the city .
#Text=Most routes cost G10 , though to get across the city you may need to use multiple routes , each of which charges separately .
#Text=These can be rather intimidating if you are n't familiar with them .
#Text=Taxis are typically about G500 and should only be used during daylight .
#Text=After dark , prices rise substantially and you are at substantially greater risk of being mugged .
#Text=See
#Text=Street parades .
#Text=On Sunday nights before Carnival , there are frequently street parades with live or recorded music and dancing .
#Text=For non-Haitians , it may be safer to watch from a distance , but it 's still exhilarating to see and hear .
#Text=These can go very late ( 1-2 am into Monday ) .
#Text=Markets
#Text=There are a number of supermarkets in the town .
#Text=Giant Supermarket ( Rue Oge & Rue Geffrard ) .
#Text=A supermarket where you can get virtually any grocery item you 'd want from the US or Europe , plus Haitian items and alcohol .
#Text=Probably the best supermarket in Pétion-Ville , if not Port-au-Prince .
#Text=Art
#Text=There are many art galleries around town , from traditional Haitian crafts ( painting , beads , metalwork ) to fine art .
#Text=Banking
#Text=There are a number of banks in Pétion-Ville .
#Text=Banks here close very early , even on the weekdays .
#Text=Eat
#Text=There are a number of good restaurants in Pétion-Ville .
#Text=Mid-range
#Text=Mr. Grill , 27b Rue Rigaud ( On Rue Riguad between Clervenau and Faubert ) , ☏ +50936204826 .
#Text=A steakhouse and guest house with a nice ambience .
#Text=The chicken kebab is tasty , as is the fried goat and skirt steak .
#Text=On Saturdays a live twoubadou band plays .
#Text=Entrees US$ 13 - 25 .
#Text=Presse Cafe , 28 Rue Rigaud ( On Rue Riguad between Clervenau and Faubert , across from Mr. Grill ) , ☏ +50928169292 .
#Text=Haitian bands play on Friday nights and sometimes other nights .
#Text=Very popular with expats and locals alike .
#Text=Sandwiches and Haitian dishes , Entrees US$ 9 - 20 .
#Text=Splurge
#Text=Quartier Latin ( On the eastern end of town near the Brazilian Embassy ) , ☏ +50925123325 .
#Text=A Latin-American restaurant with good food , tasty rum sours , and dancing to live music , mostly salsa , merengue and other Latin music .
#Text=It 's housed in an old mansion .
#Text=The View ( Corner of Rue Chavannes & Rue Clerveau ) , ☏ +50936327706 .
#Text=A variety of good food , from Haitian dishes to sushi .
#Text=The View is located on top of a 7-story building which dwarfs the rest of town .
#Text=The view alone is worth going for , spectacular if a little off-putting , as shantytowns climbing the hills are almost at eye-level .
#Text=You can see the ocean too .
#Text=Good rum sours as well , though food service can be slow .
#Text=Dishes range from US$13-$ 25 .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Crémas , an alcoholic beverage made of coconut and vanilla .
#Text=Rhum Barbancourt
#Text=Biere Prestige
#Text=Only drink Bottled Water !
#Text=Mid-range
#Text=Mr. Grill ( the steakhouse above ) has a few small rooms .
#Text=La Perroquet , 29 Rue Lamarre .
#Text=Provides simple , comfortable , clean rooms at good prices , and is located centrally .
#Text=Bar and restaurant are quite good , if a bit pricey .
#Text=The owners speak English fluently/natively and are quite helpful .
#Text=Unfortunately , burnt down in 2016 .
#Text=Has not been rebuilt .
#Text=Splurge
#Text=Hotel Villa Thérèse , 13 Rue Leon Nau Nerette , ☏ +50928162524 .
#Text=Karibe Hotel , Juvenat 7 , ☏ +509 2812-7000 ( Haiti ) , +1 305-432-9696 ( USA ) .

#Text=A very nice , very upscale hotel ( practically a resort ) with a gym , tennis courts ( with a club pro ) , pool , bars and restaurants , meeting places , etc. , all the trappings of a fancy hotel .
#Text=Rooms are very nice and prices vary , but roughly around US$ 150 a night .
#Text=Miley Cyrus stayed there , for example .
#Text=La Lorraine Boutique Hotel , 36 Rue Clerveaux , ☏ +50928168300 .
